item.name: All Notifications

exec: pm.test("Response contains a valid 'notifications' object", function () {
pm.test("Response contains a valid 'notifications' array", function () {

graphql.query:
query {
  notifications(
    options: {
      limit: 5
      offset: 0
      sortBy: "createdOn"
      sortOrder: DESC
      search: "sender@email.com"
      filters: [{ field: "applicationId", operator: "eq", value: "1" }]
    }
  ) {
    notifications {
      applicationDetails {
        applicationId
        name
        userId
        status
        createdOn
        updatedOn
      }
      applicationId
      channelType
      createdBy
      createdOn
      data
      deliveryStatus
      id
      notificationSentOn
      providerId
      result
      status
      updatedBy
      updatedOn
    }
    total,
    offset,
    limit
  }
}

request.description: Allows successfully fetching all notifications based on the options passed.

exec: pm.test("Response for fetching notifications with bad request", function () {

graphql.query:
query {
  notifications(
    options: {
      unknownValue: "Some unknown parameter"
      limit: 5
      offset: 0
      sortBy: "createdOn"
      sortOrder: DESC
      search: "sender@email.com"
      filters: [{ field: "applicationId", operator: "eq", value: "1" }]
    }
  ) {
    notifications {
      applicationDetails {
        applicationId
        name
        userId
        status
        createdOn
        updatedOn
      }
      applicationId
      channelType
      createdBy
      createdOn
      data
      deliveryStatus
      id
      notificationSentOn
      providerId
      result
      status
      updatedBy
      updatedOn
    }
    total,
    offset,
    limit
  }
}

request.description: Allows representing failure when fetching all notifications when using invalid/bad request.

item.description: Collection of requests pertaining to fetching all notifications.

item.name: Fetch Active or Archived Notification by Id
Fetch Active or Archived Notification by Id - Success

exec: pm.test("Response contains a valid 'notification' object", function () {

graphql.query:
query {
  notification(
    notificationId: 150
  ) {
      applicationId
      channelType
      createdBy
      createdOn
      data
      deliveryStatus
      id
      notificationSentOn
      providerId
      result
      status
      updatedBy
      updatedOn
    }
}

request.description: Allows successfully fetching of a notification.

item.name: Fetch Active or Archived Notification by Id - Not found exception

exec: pm.test("Response has valid 'errors' and 'data' properties", function () {
pm.test("String Response in error message", function () {

graphql.query:
query {
  notification(
    notificationId: -1
  ) {
      applicationId
      channelType
      createdBy
      createdOn
      data
      deliveryStatus
      id
      notificationSentOn
      providerId
      result
      status
      updatedBy
      updatedOn
    }
}

exec: pm.test("Response contains a valid 'archivedNotifications' object", function () {
pm.test("Response contains a valid 'archivedNotifications' array", function () {

graphql.query:
query {
  archivedNotifications(
    options: {
      limit: 5
      offset: 0
      sortBy: "createdOn"
      sortOrder: DESC
      search: "sender@email.com"
      filters: [{ field: "applicationId", operator: "eq", value: "1" }]
    }
  ) {
    archivedNotifications{
      applicationDetails {
        applicationId
        name
        userId
        status
        createdOn
        updatedOn
      }
      applicationId
      channelType
      createdBy
      createdOn
      data
      deliveryStatus
      notificationId
      notificationSentOn
      providerId
      result
      status
      updatedBy
      updatedOn
    }
    total,
    offset,
    limit
  }
}

item.name: New Provider

exec: pm.test("Response contains a valid 'provider' object", function () {

graphql.query:
mutation CreateProvider {
    provider(createProviderInput: {
        applicationId: 2,
        channelType: 2,
        configuration: {},
        isEnabled: 1,
        name: "Mailgun PineStem",
        userId: 1,
    }) {
        providerId
        applicationId
        channelType
        configuration
        isEnabled
        name
        userId
        createdOn
        updatedOn
        status
    }
}

request.description: Allows successfully creating a provider based on the options passed.

item.name: Create new Provider - Error - Invalid ApplicationId

exec: pm.test("Response has valid 'errors' and 'data' properties", function () {

graphql.query:
mutation CreateProvider {
    provider(createProviderInput: {
        # Assuming applicationId 500 is invalid
        applicationId: 500,
        channelType: 2,
        configuration: {},
        isEnabled: 1,
        name: "Mailgun PineStem",
        userId: 1,
    }) {
        providerId
        applicationId
        channelType
        configuration
        isEnabled
        name
        userId
        createdOn
        updatedOn
        status
    }
}

item.name: Fetch all Provider Chain Members
Fetch all Provider Chain Members - Success

exec: pm.test("Response contains a valid 'providerChainMembers' object", function () {
pm.test("Response contains a valid 'providerChainMembers' array", function () {

graphql.query:
query {
  providerChainMembers(
    options: {
      limit: 5
      offset: 0
      sortBy: "createdOn"
      sortOrder: ASC
      filters: [{ field: "providerId", operator: "gt", value: "3" }]
    }
  ) {
    providerChainMembers{
        id
        chainId
        providerChainDetails {
            chainId
            chainName
            description
            providerType
            applicationId
            createdOn
            updatedOn
            status
        }
        priorityOrder
        isActive
        providerId
        providerDetails {
            providerId
            name
            channelType
            isEnabled
            configuration
            applicationId
            userId
            status
        }
        createdOn
        updatedOn
        status
    }
    total,
    offset,
    limit
  }
}

request.description: Allows successfully fetching all provider chain members based on the options passed.

item.name: Fetch all Provider Chain Members - Bad Request

exec: pm.test("Response for creating new application with bad request", function () {

graphql.query:
query {
  providerChainMembers(
    options: {
      limit: 5
      offset: 0
      sortBy: "createdOn"
      sortOrder: ASC
      unknownValue: "Some unknown parameter"
      filters: [{ field: "providerId", operator: "gt", value: "3" }]
    }
  ) {
    providerChainMembers{
        id
        chainId
        providerChainDetails {
            chainId
            chainName
            description
            providerType
            applicationId
            createdOn
            updatedOn
            status
        }
        priorityOrder
        isActive
        providerId
        providerDetails {
            providerId
            name
            channelType
            isEnabled
            configuration
            applicationId
            userId
            status
        }
        createdOn
        updatedOn
        status
    }
    total,
    offset,
    limit
  }
}
